content: On October 10, 1991, the Atlanta Braves faced off against the Pittsburgh Pirates in Game 7 of the National League Championship Series. The game, held at Atlanta-Fulton County Stadium, became a legendary matchup, with Tom Glavine delivering a masterful performance, allowing just one hit over eight innings. The Braves emerged victorious 4-0, clinching their first NL pennant since moving to Atlanta, setting the stage for their memorable World Series appearance that year.
